examples: He is losing his sight and now can barely read.

definitions.definition: The act of seeing; perception of objects by the eye; view.
Something worth seeing; a spectacle , either good or bad.
examples: We went to London and saw all the sights – Buckingham Palace, Tower Bridge, and so on.
You really look a sight in that ridiculous costume!

definitions.definition: A device used in aiming a projectile , through which the person aiming looks at the intended target.
A small aperture through which objects are to be seen, and by which their direction is settled or ascertained.
a great deal, a lot; frequently used to intensify a comparative .
examples: This is a darn sight better than what I'm used to at home!

definitions.definition: In a drawing, picture, etc., that part of the surface, as of paper or canvas, which is within the frame or the border or margin. In a frame, the open space, the opening.
The instrument of seeing; the eye.

examples: In their sight it was harmless.

main_definition: ( in the singular ) The ability to see.
secondary_definitions: The act of seeing; perception of objects by the eye; view.
( often in the plural ) Something worth seeing; a spectacle , either good or bad.
( often in the plural ) A device used in aiming a projectile , through which the person aiming looks at the intended target.
A small aperture through which objects are to be seen, and by which their direction is settled or ascertained.
( now colloquial ) a great deal, a lot; frequently used to intensify a comparative .
In a drawing, picture, etc., that part of the surface, as of paper or canvas, which is within the frame or the border or margin. In a frame, the open space, the opening.
( obsolete ) The instrument of seeing; the eye.
